title: Variables

steps.hint: Now you’ll learn one of the most powerful spells in coding. But first let’s use what we know to get set up. We can set the stroke color and size all on one line. **Type** `stroke 66, black`.
We’ll make a nice big green circle, so set the drawing color with `color green`
Now let’s fill the screen with a big circle by **typing** `circle 200`
Now here’s something new. We’re going to make a variable. We’ll make it be 100, and anywhere we use the variable will get the value of the variable, which is 100. **Type** `crossSize = 100`
See how crossSize means 100? Because it means 100, we can turn it around using the same minus sign we used without the variable. **Type** `line -crossSize`.
Now to draw the bottom part **Type** `line 0, crossSize`.

completion_text: Nice! Now because you have used a variable, you can click on the number and use the slider to change the value of it. Make the plus icon into a shield! Hint: set crossSize to 200.
